key_work.title: Miniature Magic
key_work.brief_description: Some of the biggest set pieces in film and TV are actually the smallest. Big scenes can be too complicated or expensive to film with huge, life-size sets, so production teams create detailed miniatures and use camera tricks to make them appear as the real thing.

links.description: Ridley Scott’s science-fiction classic Blade Runner was considered groundbreaking for its use of miniatures to create the film’s futuristic urban landscapes. Weta Workshop in New Zealand used the same techniques for the sequel some 35 years later under the supervision of miniature artist Alex Funke.
